title: Furious Anna Vakili says it was Molly Mae Hague who snubbed her in fiery rant
text:
Get the biggest Daily Love Island stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Love Island star Anna Vakili has accused Molly Mae Hague of snubbing her in a fiery rant.

Anna spoke out after Molly Mae failed to attend her In The Style bash on Tuesday night.

Molly had also been a no-show at the launch of Anna's collection for Simmi London shoes earlier in the month.

When asked about rumours of a feud at last night's party, Anna scathed to Metro : "Some of it is such bulls**t. I hate that papers say I snubbed Molly-Mae from my launch party when I didn’t snub her from my launch party, I invited her and she didn’t come. So let’s make that very clear."

(Image: Brett Cove/SOPA Images/REX)

(Image: Brett D. Cove / SplashNews.com)

(Image: Instagram)

Slamming her public image at being seen as a 'b***h of the group, Anna then fired: "They always want to try and make me into this b***h. Why me? Why did I snub Molly-Mae? Why isn’t it that she didn’t come?

"It’s only ever me [that is] the bad one."

Anna was out on Tuesday to celebrate the launch of her In The Style collaboration with co-stars Amy Hart, Francesca Allen, Yewande Biala and Joanna Chimonides.

(Image: Brett D. Cove / SplashNews.com)

(Image: Brett D. Cove / SplashNews.com)

But 20-year-old Molly failed to show up to support her friends from the villa in their joint venture.

Molly has her own commitments with rival brand Pretty Little Thing who signed her up on a lucrative detail shortly after the Love Island final.

Anna and her four fashionista friends did offer invites to their male co-stars Christopher Taylor and Michael Griffiths though who did show up.

(Image: Brett D. Cove / SplashNews.com)

(Image: Brett D. Cove / SplashNews.com)

(Image: Brett D. Cove / SplashNews.com)

(Image: Brett D. Cove / SplashNews.com)

Love Island alumni Olivia Attwood and Gabby Allen also showed up to the party.

While Molly was a no-show at Anna's bash, it appears she had a better invite from Maura Higgins.

Two ladies had a rough time of it in the villa to start, with Maura chasing after Molly's man Tommy Fury.

But the ladies have since buried the hatchet and Molly shared a snap of them hanging out together on Tuesday night.

(Image: mollymaehague/Instagram)

Molly has also been busy moving into her new pad with boyfriend Tommy.

She shared a series of videos to Instagram of their apartment's walk in wardrobe, open plan living room and Molly's office where she will film her YouTube videos.
description: The Love Island beauty says she's tired of being seen as the 'b***' of the Love Island girls
